story:
Once upon a time, in the beautiful and diverse land of South Africa, there was a little girl named Thandi. Thandi was a kind, curious, and adventurous girl who loved exploring the world around her. She lived in a small village nestled at the foot of the majestic Drakensberg mountains, where the air was pure and the skies were a brilliant blue.

Thandi's favorite time of day was twilight, when the sun would set behind the mountains, casting a warm, golden glow over the village. The stars would begin to twinkle in the sky, and the air would fill with the gentle sounds of the African night.

One twilight, as Thandi was gazing up at the stars, she noticed that one of them was shining brighter than the others. It was a beautiful golden star, shimmering and shimmering, as if it was trying to tell her something.

Thandi felt a sudden urge to follow the star, and she set off on a journey through the Drakensberg mountains. She climbed steep paths, crossed babbling streams, and made her way deeper and deeper into the heart of the mountain range.

As she journeyed, Thandi encountered many wonderful and magical creatures. She met a wise old tortoise who taught her the secrets of the earth, a family of playful monkeys who showed her how to laugh and have fun, and a wise old owl who shared with her the wisdom of the stars.

Finally, after many days of traveling, Thandi reached the peak of the highest mountain, where the golden star had led her. And there, nestled in a hidden valley, was a magnificent palace made of pure gold, shimmering and sparkling in the twilight.

Thandi approached the palace, and as she did, the doors swung open, revealing a beautiful garden filled with the most exotic and beautiful flowers she had ever seen. And in the center of the garden stood the golden star, now transformed into a radiant princess.

The princess welcomed Thandi with open arms, and thanked her for following the star. She explained that she had been trapped in the form of a star, unable to return to her true form until someone had the courage and determination to follow her and set her free.

Thandi was overjoyed to have been the one to free the princess, and the two of them became the best of friends. They spent many happy days together in the palace, exploring the gardens and learning from each other.

And as the sun set each day, Thandi and the princess would gaze up at the stars together, remembering the journey that had brought them together and the friendship that would last a lifetime.

The end.

Goodnight my dear, dream sweet and may all your dreams come true.
